entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 21.1 a-b** *सर्वमेतद्धृषीकेशे तस्मादभ्यर्चितोऽच्युतः*
Who is worshipped by all?
A) Vishnu B) Shiva C) Duryodhana D) Bhishma
entry.answer: A) Vishnu • The verse states "Vishnu (Dhruvakesha) is worshipped by all." • Shiva and Bhishma are not mentioned as worshippers here. • Duryodhana is a king, not a deity.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 22.1 a-b** *कृष्ण एव हि लोकानामुत्पत्तिरपि चाप्ययः*
Who is the creator and destroyer of the world?
A) Shiva B) Vishnu C) Krishna D) Brahma
entry.answer: C) Krishna • The verse explicitly names Krishna as the source of creation and destruction. • Shiva and Brahma are other deities but not referenced here. • Vishnu is conflated with Krishna in some texts but the direct term is "Krishna."

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 26.1 a-b** *अयं तु पुरुषो बालः शिशुपालो न बुध्यते*
Who is the one who does not understand?
A) Shishupala B) Arjuna C) Yudhishthira D) Duryodhana
entry.answer: A) Shishupala • The verse directly names Shishupala as the one who lacks understanding. • Arjuna and Yudhishthira are wise, while Duryodhana is a rival but not the subject here.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 29.1 a-b** *अथेमां दुष्कृतां पूजां शिशुपालो व्यवस्यति*
Who performs this evil worship?
A) Shishupala B) Bhishma C) Drona D) Karna
entry.answer: A) Shishupala • The verse explicitly names Shishupala as the one performing the worship. • Bhishma and Drona are revered teachers, not associated with "evil worship."

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 30.1 a-b** *वैशम्पायन उवाच||*
Who is the speaker of the discourse?
A) Vaisampayana B) Krishna C) Bhishma D) Yudhishthira
entry.answer: A) Vaisampayana • The verse begins with "Vaisampayana said," indicating he is the speaker. • Krishna and Bhishma are characters but not the speaker here.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 31.1 a-b** *एवमुक्त्वा ततो भीष्मो विरराम महायशाः*
Who is the one who remained silent after speaking?
A) Bhishma B) Duryodhana C) Arjuna D) Krishna
entry.answer: A) Bhishma • The verse states Bhishma remained silent after speaking. • Duryodhana and Arjuna are active in dialogue, while Krishna is a speaker.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 32.1 a-b** *केशवं केशिहन्तारमप्रमेयपराक्रमम्*
Who is the slayer of Keshi (a demon)?
A) Krishna B) Arjuna C) Bhima D) Yudhishthira
entry.answer: A) Krishna • The verse directly names Krishna as the slayer of Keshi. • Arjuna and Bhima are warriors but not associated with this act.
